My snake is now at (3,6). The apples are at (2, 8), (1, 7), (0, 6), (0, 8), and (6, 3). The enemy is at (0,1).

My current head position is (3, 6). My last move was LEFT. I need to think about the safest and most efficient path to an apple.

The apples at (2,8) and (0,8) look promising. The apple at (6,3) is farther and requires a lot of change in direction. The apple at (1,7) is directly in front of the enemy so I will avoid it.

Let's consider a path to (2, 8).  I can go RIGHT to (4,6), then UP to (4,7), then UP to (4,8) and then LEFT to (3,8). Then I will move to (2,8) and eat the apple!

Alternatively, I can go UP to (3,7), then RIGHT to (4,7), then UP to (4,8), and RIGHT to (5,8). This seems like a bad idea because it's diagonal and uses more moves than necessary.

Going for (0,8) looks viable as well. First UP to (3,7), UP to (3,8), LEFT to (2,8), LEFT to (1,8), and UP to (0,8). This seems like too much work.

My best option seems to be to head to (2,8). I will go to right first, then up, up, and left!
